attachments.title: Do iOS 8's Hollow Icons Really Break People's Brains?
attachments.text: Hollow icons are all the rage, but do users have a harder time understanding them?
attachments.fallback: Co.Design: Do iOS 8's Hollow Icons Really Break People's Brains?

text: Ha, I've been following the back and forth on Twitter for the last couple of days. Some of it is extremely interesting and very useful HCI stuff.
I've also seen some Medium posts with anecdotal evidence of people ranting for and against this.
I feel like Apple is just going to do whatever the hell they want to do. And it doesn't matter because most will follow their lead no matter what.
Not that I see anything wrong with iOS 8 icons.
True. I also think Apple does a lot more testing than other companies. I have no evidence for that but their design always feels way more considered than, say, Microsoft or Google.
And, of course, sometimes they miss the mark 100%. A good example of that is the iOS 7 icon debacle last year.
And the use of Helvetica ultra thin
